intro: Aiphanes erinacea, commonly known as the hairy papyrus, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and dense, fibrous leaves that often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist or aquatic environments and is often found in marshes and along riverbanks. Aiphanes erinacea plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various organisms.
